div1.p: Hench seeks an identification of the military hospital building in the photograph.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Luis B. Pogolotti, April 30, 1940
div1.opener:
April 30, 1940
Senor Luis Pogolotti
Calle Cuba #3
Havana, Cuba
My dear Senor Pogolotti:
div1.p:
You will wonder why I have not written before. I found much work piled on
my desk on my return and almost at once there was a medical convention here which
necessitated my having a house guest. On top of that, my nine-year old boy developed
acute appendicitis and was operated upon, but he is now recovering nicely.

I cannot thank you enough for all of the courtesies you showed to me. It
was a continual surprise to me how interested you were in my problem, and you were
certainly wonderfully helpful. As you know, I am writing up my report, one copy to
go to the President of Washington and Jefferson College, one to the United States
Army Medical Museum, Washington, D. C. and one to be sent to Dr. Ramos, Secretary for
Defense, at his request. I am anxious to get the copies of the two maps when they
are available, and I left a little sum of money in Mr. Moran's hands. Please call
on him for the expenses incident to having these maps copied.

I wondered if you got the “Informes” from Ramos' secretary. I have not yet
received my copies.

Did you know that Mr. Moran called the Chief Engineer of the Havana Rail-
road, who identified the age of the railroad track by the Carninno Camp Lazear as
being built around 1865? When you have time, I should appreciate also your writing
me a more or less formal statement as to your ownership of the property at the
Carninno Camp Lazear and your former ownership of part of the San Jose farm. I
should appreciate it if you would state when your brother purchased this, to whom it
was sold, etc., giving dates and if possible a record of the deed so that we would
have a formal official statement, or at least know where information might be found
as to ownership.

I wonder if you would identify the white building in the photograph, which
I have marked. Is it the side of the Military Hospital or of one of the units of the
Military Hospital, or what building is it? I never got that point straight in my
mind, as we went by the Military Hospital so fast in the car. I refer to the white
building which one sees in the picture, as one faces the railroad track in front of
the Carninno Camp Lazear tree. If you want any more copies of these pictures, I shall
be only too glad to send them to you, and let me say again how invaluable your help
was to me. I can never thank you enough.

I will, of course, send you a copy of my report, and will probably have to
call upon you for some other help from time to time. It was so nice of you to come
down to the plane to see us off. Mrs. Hench and I appreciated it very greatly.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
